intro: Naucleopsis krukovii, commonly known as the Krukovii naucleopsis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Naucleopsis krukovii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
